meanings.definition: A plant of the daisy family, typically with yellow or orange flowers.
meanings.sent1: The calendula in the garden bloomed brightly.
meanings.sent2: I picked a bouquet of calendula for the table centerpiece.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed happily around the calendula, enjoying the nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as radiant as a field of calendula in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the calendula brightened up the entire yard.

meanings.definition: An ointment or oil made from the flowers of the calendula plant, used for medicinal purposes.
meanings.sent1: She applied calendula to her skin to soothe the irritation.
meanings.sent2: The calendula ointment had a pleasant scent.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the calendula ointment was a magical potion for healing.
meanings.sent4: The calendula oil worked wonders on her dry hands.
meanings.sent5: The medicinal properties of calendula were well-known in traditional medicine.
